content.question: Read each question carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is held at rest while compressing an ideal spring an amount <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></math>. The spring constant of the spring is <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub 2 is less than m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is released. At time <math alttext="t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, the spring is no longer compressed and Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> immediately collides with and sticks to Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The blocks stick together and the two-block system moves with constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, as shown. Frictional effects are negligible. (a) The impulse on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> from the spring during the time interval <math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> is <math alttext="J sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub></math>. The impulse on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> from Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> during the collision is <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly compares the magnitudes of <math alttext="J sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?___ <math alttext="J sub S is greater than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ___ <math alttext="J sub S is less than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ___ <math alttext="J sub S equals J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Read each question carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is held at rest while compressing an ideal spring an amount <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></math>. The spring constant of the spring is <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub 2 is less than m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is released. At time <math alttext="t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, the spring is no longer compressed and Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> immediately collides with and sticks to Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The blocks stick together and the two-block system moves with constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, as shown. Frictional effects are negligible. (a) The impulse on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> from the spring during the time interval <math alttext="0 less than t, less than t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub></math> is <math alttext="J sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub></math>. The impulse on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> from Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> during the collision is <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly compares the magnitudes of <math alttext="J sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?___ <math alttext="J sub S is greater than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ___ <math alttext="J sub S is less than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ___ <math alttext="J sub S equals J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>Justify your answer.

(b) On the following axes, draw graphs of the magnitude of the momentum of each block as a function of time, before and after <math alttext="t sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>. The collision occurs in a negligible amount of time. The grid lines on each graph are drawn to the same scale.

(c) Show that the velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> of the two-block system after the collision is given by the equation <math alttext="v equals the fraction with numerator the square root of k times m sub 1, end root, and denominator m sub 1, plus m sub 2, end fraction, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msqrt><mi>k</mi><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></msqrt><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>∆</mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>.

(d) A group of students use the setup to perform an experiment. They measure the mass of Block 1 to be <math alttext="m sub 1 equals 0.500 kilogram" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>.500 kg</mo> </math>, and the spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> of the spring to be <math alttext="150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>. The mass of Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is unknown. They perform several trials and in each trial the spring is compressed a different distance <math alttext="delta x" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>x</mi></math> and the final velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> of the two-block system is measured. They graph <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="delta x" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>x</mi></math>, as shown below. i. Draw a line that represents the best fit to the data points shown. ii. Use the best-fit line to calculate the mass of Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

(e) After the experiment, the students use a balance to measure the mass of Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and find it to be greater than what was determined in part (d). To explain this discrepancy, one of the students proposes that the spring constant was incorrectly measured at the beginning of the experiment. The students measure the spring constant again and record a new value, <math alttext="k prime" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>'</mo></math>.Should the students expect that <math alttext="k prime" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>'</mo></math> be greater than <math alttext="150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, less than <math alttext="150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, or equal to <math alttext="150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> ?_____ <math alttext="k prime is greater than 150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>></mo><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> _____ <math alttext="k prime is less than 150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>'</mo><mo><</mo><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> _____ <math alttext="k prime equals 150 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>'</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>Justify your answer.

skill.text: 1.C: Create qualitative sketches of graphs that represent features of a model or the behavior of a physical system.
